TopicTitle: KSP Grandmaster! (Land on every body of the Kerbal System!)

Articles.Content:
how did you do it so quickly.

By sleeping about six hours a night and doing literally nothing else except play KSP. I launched all the ships in a block one after another into LKO then checked which planets I could just do a burn to right away (Eve, Gilly, Duna, Ike, Kerbin, Jool) and sent those off. I used Alarm Clock which lets you set maneuver nodes and keep them if you switch ships. It stops warp 15 minutes before either a maneuver node or a change in SOI. This meant I could treat all the missions as one big mission and let alarm clock keep track of when stuff was due to need attention and what I was planning to do at that point (burn, adjust, orbit, land). It would have been impossible without Alarm Clock. Spending an hour making a universal lander helped because I was always flying a known quantity. The ship is solid enough to burn at 4x physics warp so all the burns took a quarter of the time which was nice. There was a lot of quicksaving going on especially with some of the landings (gave up on Tylo eventually and designed Universal Lander 2 which had 1500 more Dv and sent that to tylo, moho and eeloo) Landings were easy on places with an atmosphere although laythe took a couple of tries simply to hit land. Moho was just hard to get to and into orbit with enough Dv to land and Eeloo just took a looong time to get to. Tylo was a surprise, I wasn`t expecting such a large moon (That`s no moon) and Bop did bop me because I tried to orbit at 15km...

In game it took about 8 years, i real life it took about 40 hours. I put in about 3, 18 hour days. So it took a lot of time, I just did *nothing* else.

Just realised that in the challenge description you call the star Sol instead of Kerbol.

Are you an alien?

Just realised that in the challenge description you call the star Sol instead of Kerbol.

Are you an alien?

I don't know about "Sol", but "Kerbol" is incorrect: it has never been the in-game name of the Sun. blame the community
yeah the in game name is Sol....

yeah the in game name is Sol....

no, it's Sun! where did you read that?
I thought it was called Kerbol. To be fair, it makes slightly more sense and sounds really cool too
Did I get in?

I'm going to be doing this, I'm even going to be writing an AAR for it. I'll report back in this thread when I'm done!

Well I thought I would bump the thread and show a flag on all the planets as I have already landed a kerbal everywhere. I believe I am the first to put a flag everywhere.

Had to redo Mun because of the change with 0.20 and I thought I would redo Kerbin and get closer to home. (also I wanted to show off v0.1 of my flag)
